title: League Won't Open 2017
body: So I've had this problem before and managed to fix it myself, but now it's getting to the point of being aggravating. Every time I try to open league the icon pops up for maybe a second then goes away. I've looked at all the threads and youtube videos and nothing has helped so far. Should probably say that I own a mac - don't be salty plz - thanks.

replies.body:
We've seen this issue happen for a couple of reasons. The first thing I'd check is that you're launching League from the *Applications Folder*, rather than a shortcut on the dock or on the desktop. If that doesn't end up being the fix, then what's likely happening is that your client is unable to establish a solid connection to our servers. In this case, I'd say our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#section-mac) would be the best course of action, as it goes over the most commonly conflicting network settings that can cause these issues.

Let me know if this helped!

I left a comment on another page but long story short go to C drive (located in my documents, my computer), locate riot games folder, then into League of Legends folder, locate the file "LeagueClient" and if there's a messed up symbol or says error when you try to double left click on that DELETE IT. Then, a few files down is "lol.launcher" click that and it should run to the client, hit the LAUNCH button then it will do it's update. GOODLUCK!
Do you know how to fix it for Mac-users?

On my mac the above steps aren't possible. I think I'm having the same problem though. I launch the client and it freezes without ever even opening a window, regardless of if I click on the icon or try launching from the applications folder. But I found a solution that worked for me and hopefully will for everyone else on mac that the above didn't work for:

-Open Finder
->applications
-Right click on 'League of Legends' and select 'show package contents'
->LoL
-delete the file named 'lockfile'
-launch the client by clicking on 'LeagueClient' in the same folder as the file you just deleted

It works but curiously 'lockfile' reappears when you launch the client. However I closed the client and tried launching again and it worked without having to delete 'lockfile' again.

Not sure why the steps and files were different on my mac as opposed to that other solution.
How do you find this crap out? ily btw <3
Honestly just a lucky guess born from my desperation lol

when I try to my documents, there is nothing in it. Is there anything else that could work?

Okay so, 

1.) Open "My Documents"
2.) On the left panel click "This Pc"
3.) Click now on the main menu "Local Disk C Drive" (That's where games usually auto install unless when you originally installed your league you moved it into a different drive in that case find that drive.)
4.) Open the "Riot Games" folder
5.) Open "League of Legends" folder
6.) Scroll down until you locate the file called "LeagueClient" this is where my fix works, if the symbol beside that file is an "X" or when you right click on the file and "Error" pops up then this WILL help you. If not I'm not entirely sure.
7.) DELETE THE "LEAGUECLIENT" FILE
8.) In the same folder, a few files down click "lol.launcher" and it should run the client.
9.) From the client hit the LAUNCH button and voila!
